Module geci.tools
Package javax0.geci.tools

Class JavaSource

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax0.geci.tools.JavaSource
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable
    public class JavaSource
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.AutoCloseable
    A simple tool to write code into a string.

    • Method Detail

      • builder

        public static JavaSource.Builder builder()

      • write

        public JavaSource write​(java.lang.String s,
                        java.lang.Object... parameters)
        Write a string with format placeholders into the underlying string. If the string is multi line (contains \n) then each line will be aligned to the actual tab stop.

        If the line is terminated with one or more \n characters then they will be removed and the line will be terminated with a single new line character.

        Parameters:
        s - the format string
        parameters - optional parameters
        Returns:
        this

        Returns:

        Parameters:

        parameters - optional parameters
        Returns:

        Parameters:

        parameters - optional parameters
        Returns:

      • write_lr

        public JavaSource write_lr​(java.lang.String s,
                           java.lang.Object... parameters)
        Write a line that is pulled left but then again the next to the right. Typically this is else lines.
        Parameters:
        s - the line to be added to the code
        parameters - the format parameters
        Returns:
        this

      • open

        public JavaSource open​(java.lang.String s,
                       java.lang.Object... parameters)
        You can use this method in the try-with-resources output
        Parameters:
        s - the line that opens the block without the $&#123;at the end of the line. That will automatically be appended.
        parameters - parameters of the line
        Returns:
        this
